title: Bad Combination of Virtual Packages and buildable:False
body:
Consider the following packages.yaml file:

```
packages:
    all:
        compiler: [gcc@5.3.0]
        providers:
            mpi: [openmpi]
            blas: [openblas]
            lapack: [openblas]
```

`spack spec nccmp` gives the correct answer (nccmp depends_on('netcdf') only):

```
Concretized
------------------------------
  nccmp@1.8.2.0%gcc@5.3.0=linux-x86_64
      ^netcdf@4.4.0%gcc@5.3.0~hdf4+mpi=linux-x86_64
          ^curl@7.47.1%gcc@5.3.0=linux-x86_64
              ^openssl@1.0.2g%gcc@5.3.0=linux-x86_64
                  ^zlib@1.2.8%gcc@5.3.0=linux-x86_64
          ^hdf5@1.8.16%gcc@5.3.0~cxx~debug+fortran+mpi+shared~szip~threadsafe=linux-x86_64
              ^openmpi@1.10.2%gcc@5.3.0~psm~tm~verbs=linux-x86_64
                  ^hwloc@1.11.2%gcc@5.3.0=linux-x86_64
                      ^libpciaccess@0.13.4%gcc@5.3.0=linux-x86_64
                          ^libtool@2.4.6%gcc@5.3.0=linux-x86_64
```

Suppose I want to use a system-installed MPI.  I change `packages.yaml` to:

```
packages:
    openmpi:
        paths:
            openmpi@system: /usr/local/other/SLES11.3/openmpi/1.10.1/gcc-5.3
        buildable: False
    all:
        compiler: [gcc@5.3.0]
        providers:
            mpi: [openmpi]
            blas: [openblas]
            lapack: [openblas]
```

Now, `spack spec nccmp` tries to (wrongly) load `mvapich2` instead of `openmpi`:

```
Concretized
------------------------------
  nccmp@1.8.2.0%gcc@5.3.0=linux-x86_64
      ^netcdf@4.4.0%gcc@5.3.0~hdf4+mpi=linux-x86_64
          ^curl@7.47.1%gcc@5.3.0=linux-x86_64
              ^openssl@1.0.2g%gcc@5.3.0=linux-x86_64
                  ^zlib@1.2.8%gcc@5.3.0=linux-x86_64
          ^hdf5@1.8.16%gcc@5.3.0~cxx~debug+fortran+mpi+shared~szip~threadsafe=linux-x86_64
              ^mvapich2@2.2b%gcc@5.3.0~debug~gforker~hydra~mrail~nemesis~nemesisib~nemesisibtcp~psm~remshell~slurm~sock=linux-x86_64
```
